revision.text:
{{Infobox soap character | series = Neighbours | name = Aaron Brennan | image = Aaron Brennan.JPG | imagesize = 200px | portrayer = Matt Wilson | introducer = [[Jason Herbison]] | years = 2015– | first = {{Start date|2015|06|16|df=y}} | classification = [[List of Neighbours characters#Present characters|Current; regular]] | home = [[Ramsay Street#No. 24|24 Ramsay Street]] | occupation = {{plainlist| *Exotic dancer *Bodyguard *Executive assistant *Social media manager *Gym co-owner }} | family = [[Robinson family|Robinson]] | father = [[Russell Brennan]] | mother = [[Fay Brennan]] | husband = [[David Tanaka]] (2018–) | brothers = [[Mark Brennan (Neighbours)|Mark Brennan]] | sisters = [[Chloe Brennan (Neighbours)|Chloe Brennan]] | halfbrothers = [[Tyler Brennan]] }} '''Aaron Brennan''' is a fictional character from the Australian soap opera ''[[Neighbours]]'', played by Matt Wilson. The actor received the role after a long casting process, during which Wilson sent the producers a recording of himself performing a scene, before attending an audition. Wilson relocated from Sydney to Melbourne for filming. The character was initially intended to be a guest part, but due to Wilson's "endearing quality", he was promoted to the full-time cast. He made his first screen appearance during the episode broadcast on 16 June 2015. Aaron was the third Brennan sibling to be introduced, following his brothers [[Mark Brennan (Neighbours)|Mark]] ([[Scott McGregor (model)|Scott McGregor]]) and [[Tyler Brennan]] ([[Travis Burns (actor)|Travis Burns]]) in 2010 and 2015 respectively.
Aaron is portrayed as a confident, happy, occasionally naive, optimist. He was initially shown to be closer to Tyler than Mark, but the brothers were bonded when their estranged father was introduced. The character had a unique entrance to the show as an exotic dancer performing at The Waterhole. Wilson took dance lessons ahead of his first scenes. Aaron has embarked on various careers throughout his duration, including bodyguard and social media manager. Aaron is openly gay, and he has formed relationships with established regular [[Nate Kinski]] ([[Meyne Wyatt]]), despite initially having nothing in common, and later [[Tom Quill]] (Kane Felsinger) and [[David Tanaka]] ([[Takaya Honda]]). The character has received a positive response from television critics and viewers. He was named Best New Male Character of 2015 by a columnist for ''Soap World''.
==Casting== On 17 May 2015, it was announced actor and model Matt Wilson had joined the cast as Aaron Brennan, the middle brother of established characters [[Mark Brennan (Neighbours)|Mark Brennan]] ([[Scott McGregor (model)|Scott McGregor]]) and [[Tyler Brennan]] (Travis Burns).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a647877/all-change-for-neighbours-four-new-regulars-join-the-soaps-cast/#~pcYKylGLFjEg03|title=All change for Neighbours: Four new regulars join the soap's cast|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=17 May 2015|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref> Wilson was given the role of Aaron after a long casting process.<ref name="Kilkelly">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/interviews/a654854/neighbours-newcomer-matt-wilson-interview-more-brennans-will-arrive/|title=Neighbours newcomer Matt Wilson interview: 'More Brennans will arrive'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=25 June 2015|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref> The process started with Wilson recording himself performing a scene and sending the footage to the producers, who then invited him to attend an audition.<ref name="Kilkelly"/> During the lengthy waiting period, Wilson watched the show "religiously", which made him want to be a part of the cast even more.<ref name="Molloy"/> Months after his audition, Wilson was sent an email informing him he had won the role.<ref name="Kilkelly"/> Of joining the cast, Wilson said "It's surreal. This stuff is part of your living room growing up and never in my wildest dreams did I think I would have this chance."<ref name="Bamford">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/matt-wilson-welcome-to-our-newest-neighbour/story-fni0cvc9-1227378507617|title=Matt Wilson: Welcome to our newest Neighbour|last=Bamford|first=Matt|date=1 June 2015|work=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref> Wilson relocated from Sydney to Melbourne, where the ''Neighbours'' studios are located.<ref name="Molloy">{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/national/hunky-underwear-model-and-actor-matt-wilson-arrives-on-ramsay-street-playing-a-gay-male-stripper/story-e6frfkp9-1227400639625|title=Hunky underwear model and actor Matt Wilson arrives on Ramsay Street, playing a gay male stripper|last=Molloy|first=Shannon|date=17 June 2016|publisher=[[news.com.au]]|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref> He made his debut appearance as Aaron during the episode broadcast on 16 June 2015.<ref name="Bamford"/> Executive producer [[Jason Herbison]] later revealed that Aaron was only ever intended to be a guest character, but Wilson's "endearing quality" led him to be promoted to the full-time cast.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Ellis|first=Sarah|date=3–9 October 2015|title=I'm proud of how hard we worked on the 30th anniversary episodes!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=39|pages=44–46}}</ref>
==Development==
===Characterisation=== In his fictional backstory, Aaron left his hometown of [[Port Lincoln]] shortly after Mark's departure. Aaron had not seen his brothers in six years, as he was living on the other side of the country, but they had kept in contact and stayed close.<ref name="CCrick">{{cite journal|last=Crick|first=Claire|date=20 June – 3 July 2015|title=I'm prepared for lots of topless scenes!|journal=[[All About Soap]]|issue=351|pages=28–29}}</ref> Aaron gets bored doing the same job every day and he eventually realised that working down the mines was not something he wanted to do anymore.<ref name="CCrick"/> Wilson told Claire Crick of ''[[All About Soap]]'' that after Aaron saw a male dance show in Perth, he made "a snap decision" to become an exotic dancer. Wilson said Aaron's career choice was similar to the characters featured in the 2012 film ''[[Magic Mike]]''.<ref name="CCrick"/>
At the time of his arrival, Aaron was much closer to his younger brother Tyler as they both liked to live in the moment, whereas Mark was a bit more sensible and [[Obsessive compulsive disorder|OCD]].<ref name="CCrick"/> Wilson thought Aaron liked being the middle brother because he loves to be the centre of attention. The actor commented, "There's definitely no middle-child syndrome here! He's quick to mediate any arguments between the other two."<ref name="CCrick"/> Wilson also said Aaron was opportunistic like Tyler, but he understood limitations like Mark.<ref name="CCrick"/> McGregor opined Mark's younger siblings made him a stronger character, while Burns thought Aaron's arrival had changed the dynamic between Mark and Tyler.<ref name="Brennans"/>
Wilson described Aaron as "a very confident young guy", who loves life and is not easily fazed. He also likes to make others happy.<ref name="Molloy"/> The actor also told Daniel Kilkelly of [[Digital Spy]]: "Aaron's an infectious person. He's really happy, he's an optimist, he's got a lot of energy and there's a really good vibe which comes off him. He's received well by absolutely everyone."<ref name="Kilkelly"/> A writer for the official ''Neighbours'' website described the character has having "a big heart, and a cheeky streak."<ref name="AB">{{cite web|url=http://tenplay.com.au/channel-eleven/neighbours/characters/aaron-brennan|title=Matt Wilson as Aaron Brennan|publisher=[[Tenplay]]|accessdate=24 June 2016}}</ref> They also said Aaron's family was important to him and he would do anything for his siblings.<ref name="AB"/> Speaking to Hazel Bradley of ''[[The West Australian]]'', Wilson admitted that he shared some similarities with his character, such as optimism and selflessness. However, Wilson thought Aaron was also naïve and occasionally vulnerable.<ref name="Bradley"/>
Aaron is openly gay, and Wilson told Peter Gray of ''[[Q News (Australian magazine)|Q News]]'' that he felt no pressure portraying a gay character, as there was a lot of support for Aaron.<ref name="Gray">{{cite web|url=http://www.qnews.com.au/meet-matt-wilson-ramsay-streets-hottest-resident/|title=Meet Matt Wilson, Ramsay Street's hottest resident|last=Gray|first=Peter|date=5 September 2015|work=[[Q News (Australian magazine)|Q News]]|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> He called Aaron "a typical Aussie gay guy", which, he believed, was not well represented on Australian television at the time.<ref name="Gray"/> Wilson turned to his own gay friends while researching Aaron's wardrobe. He thought the character was similar to them and based the clothing on items they wear.<ref name="Knox">{{cite web|url=http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2016/03/ok-to-be-gay-in-erinsborough-says-matt-wilson.html|title=Ok to be gay in Erinsborough, says Matt Wilson|last=Knox|first=David|date=24 March 2016|publisher=[[TV Tonight]]|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Wilson thought Aaron would be a good boyfriend because he was romantic, but his career put a strain on his past relationships.<ref name="CCrick"/> While his siblings have accepted Aaron's sexuality, their father struggled with it, but Aaron refused to let it get to him.<ref name="AB"/>
===Introduction=== {{Quote box|width=19%|align=right|bgcolor=#F0F8FF|quote="I knew this could not be a better way to enter a show. Some people arrive on Neighbours in a taxi on the Street, but Aaron comes in with an absolute bang so I was quite honoured to be playing him."<ref name="Kilkelly"/>|source=—Wilson on Aaron's unique entrance to the show. (2015)}} Mark contacted Aaron after fearing that Tyler had "gone off the rails", following his arrest. Mark knew Aaron and Tyler had a close relationship and he needed Aaron's help.<ref name="Brennans">{{cite journal|last=Ellis|first=Sarah|date=27 June – 3 July 2015|title=We joke that the Brennans must be allergic to t-shirts!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=25|pages=32–34}}</ref> Both Mark and Tyler assumed Aaron still worked down the mines in Western Australia, but he had secretly switched careers to become an exotic dancer. At the same time Mark contacted Aaron, he was booked to appear at a charity bingo night hosted by [[Sheila Canning]] ([[Colette Mann]]) at The Waterhole.<ref name="Flesh">{{cite journal|last=Crawford|first=Carena|date=20 June – 3 July 2015|title=In the flesh!|journal=[[All About Soap]]|issue=351|pages=22–23}}</ref> Aaron was set to perform his routine in the bar when bingo was called. Sheila encouraged Mark and Tyler to attend the event and they were "stunned" to see their brother half-naked on the stage.<ref name="Flesh"/>
Wilson explained that he had no dance experience coming into the show and took private lessons ahead of filming. He commented, "I hit the stage with 100 per cent confidence, so all of my efforts paid off!"<ref name="Brennans"/> Mark was unimpressed with his younger brother's new career choice and berated him for it, while Tyler was amused. He was further cheered up when Aaron helped him out at the garage. Mark made an effort to bond with his brothers, after seeing how close Aaron and Tyler were.<ref name="Flesh"/>
===Relationship with Nate Kinski=== As Aaron settled onto [[Ramsay Street]], Tyler learned he was single and he decided to try and set Aaron up on a date with his friend [[Nate Kinski]] ([[Meyne Wyatt]]). Tyler's motive for the matchmaking scheme was his need to repair his broken friendship with Nate, who had not forgiven him for stealing a prescription pad from [[Karl Kennedy]] ([[Alan Fletcher (actor)|Alan Fletcher]]).<ref name="Flesh"/> Aaron and Nate's first meeting did not go well, as they disagreed about everything and realised that they had nothing in common. Despite Tyler's efforts to get them to agree on something, Aaron and Nate realised what he was trying to do and told him that nothing was going to happen between them.<ref name="Flesh"/> Tyler's scheme did manage to get Nate to reconcile with him.<ref name="Flesh"/> Of the scenes, Wilson told Kilkelly: "Although Aaron is quite an infectious person and everyone receives him really well, for some unbeknown reason Nate just gives him the cold shoulder. Aaron doesn't really know how to handle that. The scene where Tyler tries to set us up is hilarious - it's an absolute car crash of a scene!"<ref name="Kilkelly"/>
Nate initially did not want anything to do with Aaron, but then Aaron got involved with his feud with [[Alistair Hall]] (Nick Cain) in an effort to help him out. Wilson said that Nate did not like Aaron's "game-playing".<ref name="CCrick"/> Sheila later charged a reluctant Nate with the task of getting Aaron to sign an employment contract for The Waterhole. Nate kept making snide comments about Aaron's career, so he refused to sign the contract.<ref name="Feeling">{{cite journal|date=2–16 July 2015|title=Can't fight the feeling|journal=TV Soap|page=45}}</ref> Sheila told Nate to make things right with Aaron, forcing him to beg. Aaron enjoyed seeing Nate's discomfort and agreed to sign the contract if he only dealt with Sheila.<ref name="Feeling"/> However, when Sheila suffered [[trismus|lock jaw]], she forced Aaron and Nate to work together and they could resist taunting each other. Nate teased Aaron by telling him he found him to be attractive, while Aaron went to kiss him, only to pull away quickly.<ref name="Feeling"/> A ''TV Soap'' writer observed "it's beginning to look like there might be a mutual attraction behind Nate and Aaron's guarded exteriors."<ref name="Feeling"/>
Aaron and Nate were forced to spend more time together when [[Naomi Canning]] ([[Morgana O'Reilly]]) locked them in an outdoor hotel room with a glass front as part of a promotion for Lassiter's Hotel.<ref name="Public">{{cite journal|date=25–31 July 2015|title=Public passion!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=29|page=24}}</ref> The storyline started with Naomi hiring Aaron and a female model to pose as a happy couple. However, when the female model failed to turn up, Naomi grabbed Nate and locked him inside the room with Aaron.<ref name="Public"/> Nate decided to make the most of the situation and he hoped he could annoy Aaron in the process. Wyatt said, "after a while Nate doesn't even notice the audience and starts to lighten up, which surprises Aaron."<ref name="Public"/> Naomi's plan was a success, as Lassiter's received positive press about its support for same-sex relationships. She then asked the men to do something special for a photograph and Nate spontaneously kissed Aaron.<ref name="Public"/> Nate enjoyed the kiss and it became clear that he had strong feelings for Aaron. Wyatt thought the characters were "a good balance", but a future relationship depended on whether they could be themselves around each other.<ref name="Public"/>
When Aaron attempted to cheer up his friend [[Josh Willis (Neighbours)|Josh Willis]] ([[Harley Bonner]]) by acting as his [[wingman (social)|wingman]] for the evening, he put himself in danger when her boyfriend [[Evan Shields]] (Daniel Fischer) appeared.<ref name="Rescue">{{cite journal|date=5–11 September 2015|title=Nate races to the rescue!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=35|page=25}}</ref> Aaron tried to smooth things over, but he and Evan squared up to each other, leaving Josh to defuse the situation.<ref name="Rescue"/> As Aaron walked home, Evan appeared and threw a drink in his face, before attacking him.<ref name="Rescue"/> Wilson said it was a "pretty bad" moment, but Nate came to Aaron's rescue and dragged Evan away, before scaring him off. Aaron did not have a chance to thank Nate, as he left the scene.<ref name="Rescue"/> Neither Aaron and Nate were willing to accept that they had romantic feelings for each other.<ref name="Trick">{{cite journal|date=27 August – 10 September 2015|title=Trick or treat|journal=TV Soap|page=41}}</ref> Nate believed Aaron was not interested in him, so when Aaron offered to be his slave for the week to make up for injuring him during [[Tai Chi]], Nate was unaware Aaron was trying to flirt with him.<ref name="Trick"/> Nate later confronted Aaron, who confessed to having feelings for him. But Nate thought Aaron was joking and Aaron was "crushed" by his rejection. Tyler then told Nate that his brother was attracted to him.<ref name="Trick"/>
Aaron and Nate eventually developed a relationship. After Nate got involved in a fight, he decided to leave town to clear his head. Aaron was "angry and upset" when he learnt that Nate had returned to Australia and had not been in contact with him.<ref name="Ethical"/> Wilson said Aaron and Nate had "a lot of stuff to sort out",<ref name="Falconer"/> while adding that the characters wanted to be together, but were unsure if they could make it work.<ref name="Crawford">{{cite journal|last=Crawford|first=Carena|date=23 April – 6 May 2016|title=Aaron really thought he'd killed someone!|journal=[[All About Soap]]|issue=373|pages=32–33}}</ref> He continued, "Ever since they first met they've always argued about the small suff and they're still doing it now."<ref name="Crawford"/> Wilson later commented that as much as they loved each other, they could not live with each other because they were opposites.<ref name="Pants">{{cite journal|date=30 April – 6 May 2016|title=My friends send me pictures of me in my pants!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=17|pages=52–53}}</ref> He also said that the couple complemented one another well, as "Nate is really closed off, whereas Aaron is a lot more free and happy."<ref name="Pants"/> When Nate eventually returned, he struggled to reconnect with Aaron and was "gutted" to learn that Aaron had moved on with someone else while he was away.<ref name="Conscience">{{cite journal|date=9–15 April 2016|title=Aaron's guilty conscience?|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=14|page=32}}</ref> Wilson added that Aaron resists a reconciliation as he has been hurt.<ref name="Crawford"/>
===Career changes and Tom Quill=== After giving up exotic dancing, Aaron briefly sold coffee and then worked as a bodyguard for "resident baddie" [[Paul Robinson (Neighbours)|Paul Robinson]] ([[Stefan Dennis]]).<ref name="Bradley"/><ref name="Next">{{cite web|url=http://tenplay.com.au/channel-eleven/neighbours/features/whats-next-for-aaron-brennan|title=What's Next for Aaron Brennan?|date=2 December 2015|publisher=[[Tenplay]]|accessdate=22 June 2016}}</ref> However, Aaron struggled to cope with Paul's various schemes.<ref name="Next"/> In March 2016, Wilson teased a new darker storyline for Aaron, saying "I can't talk about it yet but anything where you have to go to the dark places in your mind is really challenging."<ref name="Bradley"/> Aaron was later hired to be new mayor [[Sonya Rebecchi]]'s ([[Eve Morey]]) executive assistant, and Wilson joked "I get to wear a lot of suits from here on in, which is better than wearing next to nothing, which is how I first came on the show."<ref name="Bradley">{{cite news|url=https://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/entertainment/a/31056887/new-neighbour-makes-waves/|title=Developing role suits Matt|last=Bradley|first=Hazel|date=10 March 2016|work=[[The West Australian]]|accessdate=22 June 2016}}</ref> Aaron also attracted the attentions of [[Tom Quill]] (Kane Felsinger), the development manager for Lassiter's Hotel.<ref name="Ethical">{{cite journal|date=April 2016|title=Ethical dilemmas|journal=Soap World|issue=280|page=16}}</ref> Aaron accepted some champagne from Tom, before realising that it could be seen as conflict of interest as Tom wanted to know Sonya's position on the proposed expansion of Lassiter's. Aaron later returned the gift to Tom, who made an advance on Aaron. As he was hurting over Nate's silence, Aaron agreed to go on a date with Tom.<ref name="Ethical"/> Following the success of the first date, Aaron and Tom went on another and Tom learnt that approval for the Lassiter's expansion could take months. He persuaded Aaron to give him a list of everyone opposed to the expansion and when Aaron discovered they had withdrawn their opposition, he knew he had "crossed the ethical line."<ref name="Ethical"/>
Tom then used Aaron's laptop to doctor an environmental impact report, leading the council to approve the development. Aaron then realised Tom had taken advantage of him and told Sonya, who fired him.<ref name="Ethical"/> Shortly after, an explosion at the Lassiter's Hotel dominated the show's storylines and Aaron was shown to have "a guilty conscience" over something.<ref name="Falconer">{{cite web|url=http://www.femalefirst.co.uk/tv/matt-wilson-exclusive-neighbours-interview-hotel-death-trap-week-aaron-brennan-935271.html|title=Matt Wilson exclusive Neighbours interview - Aaron's role in Hotel Death Trap Week|last=Falconer|first=Daniel|date=5 April 2016|publisher=FemaleFirst|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Aaron was later "anxious" to know if Tom was okay, as he had not been since that day. After hearing that Tom's ID had been found in the wreckage, Aaron feared that he was dead and tried to push Nate away. But when Nate pressed him, Aaron admitted that if Tom was dead, then it was down to him.<ref name="Conscience"/> In an interview with Carena Crawford of ''All About Soap'', Wilson detailed the events in the lead up to the explosion, saying "Aaron knew Tom was dodgy and went on a hunt to find out exactly what was going on. The last time Aaron saw Tom they had a bit of an altercation and got into a fight in the hotel boiler room."<ref name="Crawford"/> Wilson went on to explain that Aaron hit Tom and then walked away, leaving Tom in a semi-conscious state. When the boiler room exploded shortly afterwards, Aaron believed that Tom had been killed.<ref name="Crawford"/>
In what was billed as "a tense storyline", Aaron began receiving threatening text message from an unknown sender who knew what he did to Tom.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a791824/neighbours-spoilers-aaron-brennan-gets-threatening-text-message/|title=Neighbours spoilers: First look as Aaron Brennan is horrified by a threatening text message|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=25 April 2016|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Aaron initially tried to keep the messages to himself, but he was "freaking out" as he could be charged with manslaughter or murder if his secret came out.<ref name="Crawford"/> Nate believed Tom's mother [[Julie Quill]] (Gail Easdale) might be behind the messages, as she had been asking Aaron a lot of questions about the day of the explosion and his relationship with Tom.<ref name="Crawford"/> However, once Nate discovered it was not Julie, Aaron thought that it would be best if he went to the police. Wilson told Carena Crawford of ''All About Soap'', "Aaron's finding it hard to walk around Erinsborough thinking that he's killed someone."<ref name="Crawford"/> The person behind the messages soon demanded $10,000 from Aaron, giving Nate a chance to set up a trap. He hid some money in an envelope at an old well and when they mystery person picked it up, they caught him.<ref name="Crawford"/> The person behind the messages turned out to be Tom, and Wilson said Aaron experienced "really mixed emotions" when he saw him. Aaron really believed he had killed someone and was facing time in prison and when he realised that was not going to happen, he wanted to stop Tom.<ref name="Crawford"/> Aaron then declared that he was going to tell Mark, but Nate warned him that he could still face charges for punching Tom.<ref name="Crawford"/>
===David Tanaka=== {{Quote box|width=17%|align=right|bgcolor=#F0F8FF|quote="I think they're perfect because they're not the same person, they're the complete opposite. Aaron is everything David wants to be and David is everything Aaron wants to be. So they kind of look up to each other in a way, which is really cute."<ref name="Big">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/interviews/a831964/neighbours-spoilers-matt-wilson-interview-aaron-brennan/|title=Neighbours star Matt Wilson reveals gossip on Aaron, David and the Brennans' mum in our big interview|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=29 June 2017|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=2 July 2017}}</ref> |source=—Wilson on Aaron and David.}} In 2016, producers introduced the Tanaka twins [[David Tanaka|David]] ([[Takaya Honda]]) and [[Leo Tanaka|Leo]] (Tim Kano), who move to Erinsborough. Aaron is initially attracted to Leo, while his friend [[Amy Williams (Neighbours)|Amy Williams]] ([[Zoe Cramond]]) likes David.<ref name="Hooked">{{cite journal|date=3–17 October 2016|title=Hooked on a feeling|journal=TV Soap|page=45}}</ref> Aaron organises a night out at the Back Lane Bar in the city for the group, where Aaron realises that Leo is straight and interested in Amy. Aaron leaves the bar early, but he later sets up Amy and David on a date.<ref name="Hooked"/> However, he shares an "intense moment" with David, leading him to believe that David is gay. He goes to warn Amy, but is too late and she goes on her date with David. Aaron later confronts David, who insists that he is not gay and that he likes Amy.<ref name="Hooked"/> Aaron later helps organises a day out for David's great-grandmother [[Kazuko Sano]] (Linda Chin) and they bond. Aaron also urges David to question Kazuko about his biological father, but David is hurt by Kazuko's angry reaction.<ref name="Turmoil">{{cite journal|date=December 2016|title=David in turmoil|journal=Soap World|issue=289|pages=18}}</ref> Aaron tries to apologise to David, but David thinks he is making romantic advances towards him and insults Aaron's homosexuality. He later apologises and they share another moment.<ref name="Turmoil"/>
After realising that he should embrace his sexuality, David goes to Number 24 late at night to see Aaron and potentially confess his feelings for him. But in a storyline twist, Aaron admits that he is not alone and actually has another man in his room, causing David to leave quickly.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a821675/neighbours-david-tanaka-aaron-brennan-missed-chance/|title=Neighbours' David Tanaka misses his chance when Aaron Brennan has another guy in bed|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=20 February 2017|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=2 July 2017}}</ref> David [[comes out]] and realises he has feelings for Aaron. They spend ANZAC Day together, but when David tries to kiss Aaron, he is rejected.<ref name="KissOff">{{cite journal|last=Ellis|first=Sarah|date=22–28 April 2017|title=Kiss off!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=16|page=47}}</ref> Wilson said that Aaron is not expecting the kiss, as he was thinking about Nate at the time. David feels embarrassed and runs off, which Wilson thought was true to the character.<ref name="KissOff"/> He explained, "They are pretty much opposites – Aaron will always stand and fight, whereas David always chooses flight."<ref name="KissOff"/> In an interview on [[Tenplay]], Wilson explains that while Aaron does have feelings for David, he knows that David needs to deal with his sexuality and have some fun first. Aaron hopes that David will return to him eventually.<ref name="SurpriseKiss">{{cite web|url=https://tenplay.com.au/channel-eleven/neighbours/show-news/matt-wilson-on-davids-surprise-kiss|title=Matt Wilson on David's surprise kiss|date=26 April 2017|publisher=[[Tenplay]]|accessdate=2 July 2017}}</ref> Wilson liked the pairing of Aaron and David, calling them "a great couple", and he thought they could get married in the future.<ref name="SurpriseKiss"/>
A few months later, Aaron and David begin a relationship.<ref name="AGardner">{{cite web|url=https://www.whatsontv.co.uk/neighbours/neighbours-news/aaron-tell-david-matt-wilson-482435/|title='The time is right for Aaron to tell David how he feels,' says Neighbours' Matt Wilson|last=Gardner|first=Alison|date=11 July 2017|work=[[What's on TV]]|accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> Wilson said it was getting increasingly harder for Aaron to be without David, as he explores his sexuality, as Aaron was in love with him. Wilson also pointed out that it was obvious to everyone else that the pair should be a couple.<ref name="AGardner"/> David's brother Leo "becomes sick of the guys misreading each other’s signals" and forces Aaron to tell David about his feelings for him during a karaoke event at The Waterhole.<ref name="AGardner"/> Wilson said the couple's relationship would have "great potential" for future storylines.<ref name="AGardner"/>
===Family introductions=== [[File:April Rose Pengilly (6280501914).jpg|thumb|left|145px|April Rose Pengilly was introduced as Aaron's younger sister Chloe in March 2018.]] A month after Aaron's arrival, the Brennan brothers' father [[Russell Brennan]] (Russell Kiefel) was introduced and the family became the focus of a "controversial" domestic violence storyline.<ref name="Russell">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s14/neighbours/news/a655527/neighbours-to-introduce-russell-brennan-for-domestic-violence-plot.html#~ph2vYw8rTunQkt|title=Neighbours to introduce Russell Brennan for domestic violence plot|last=Dainty|first=Sophie|date=29 June 2015|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Russell abused his sons as they were growing up and the brothers later became estranged from him. Russell wants to prove that he is a changed man.<ref name="Russell"/> While Mark is pleased to see his father, Tyler tries to avoid him, and Aaron is thinks about Russell's negative reaction upon learning he had a gay son.<ref>{{cite journal|date=8–14 August 2015|title=Meet Russell Brennan|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=31|page=26}}</ref> Russell makes plans to buy the local garage with his sons, but Tyler is still unhappy to be reunited with him. When Tyler punches Russell, he eventually tells Aaron and Mark about the abuse he had suffered at the hands of their father.<ref name="RBLeaves">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a667954/soap-spoilers-russell-brennan-leaves-in-neighbours-and-phoebe-discovers-shes-pregnant-in-home-and-away/|title=Soap spoilers: Russell Brennan leaves in Neighbours and Phoebe discovers she's pregnant in Home and Away|last=Dainty|first=Sophie|date=12 September 2015|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Mark is initially sceptical, until he talks with Aaron and they confront Russell, who does not deny the accusations. Aaron and Mark support their younger brother and ask Russell to leave town.<ref name="RBLeaves"/>
Producers planned to bring Russell back, but the storyline had to be rewritten due to Kiefel's unexpected death. In 2017, it was announced the Brennan brothers' mother [[Fay Brennan]] ([[Zoe Bertram]]) would be introduced instead.<ref name="Big"/> Wilson said that the brothers have various issues with their mother and Aaron acts "very out of character" towards her. Wilson enjoyed exploring the family dynamic further, as well as playing Aaron's unpredictable reaction to her arrival.<ref name="Big"/> He also said some viewers would be able to relate to the issues that Aaron and his mother have.<ref name="Big"/> Aaron later admits to his partner, David, that he resents Fay for leaving the family, as he was just thirteen years old and trying to deal with his sexuality.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/spoilers/a833738/neighbours-spoilers-aaron-declares-his-love-for-david/|title=Neighbours spoiler: Aaron declares his love for David|last=Kilkelly|first=David|date=22 July 2017|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=31 August 2018}}</ref> David encourages Aaron to resolve his issues with his mother, and Wilson stated that Aaron and Fay would "go through the whole process of resolving that."<ref name="Big"/>
The following year, Aaron, Mark and Tyler's younger sister [[Chloe Brennan (Neighbours)|Chloe Brennan]] ([[April Rose Pengilly]]) was introduced.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/inxs-legend-kirk-pengillys-daughter-april-rose-is-joining-longrunning-soap-neighbours/news-story/a76ee6e4b588c22bccbe399284546d96?nk=cfb429b18655ca0e93ccfee99540e4e4-1519917589|title=INXS legend Kirk Pengilly's daughter April Rose joins long-running soap Neighbours|last=Stephenson|first=Alison|date=1 March 2018|work=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=31 August 2018}}</ref> Chloe's backstory states that when Russell and Fay's marriage ended, she went to live with her mother, while the brothers stayed with Russell. The siblings only saw each other during the holidays and at Christmas.<ref name="Chloe">{{cite web|url=https://www.radiotimes.com/news/2018-03-27/neighbours-chloe-brennan-has-a-big-heart-and-a-big-mouth-april-rose-pengilly-interview/|title=Neighbours: 'Chloe Brennan has a big heart – and a big mouth!' April Rose Pengilly interview|last=Hughes|first=Johnathon|date=27 March 2018|work=[[Radio Times]]|accessdate=30 August 2018}}</ref> Chloe comes to Erinsborough in an attempt to reconnect with Aaron and Mark.<ref name="Chloe"/>
===Other storylines=== When Josh learns Aaron is looking for someone else to join his dance act, he auditions for the place, as he needs to raise money for an operation for his sick daughter.<ref name="Private">{{cite journal|last=Ellis|first=Sarah|date=15–21 August 2015|title=Private dancer!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=32|page=25}}</ref> Aaron and Josh then form an exotic dance duo called The Heat. Josh is "terrified" when The Heat receive their first booking, a 50th birthday party at the community centre.<ref name="Private"/> Aaron and Josh put together a routine on the day and while the performance starts off "a bit rough", the female audience enjoy it. Aaron also enjoys the attention, while Josh receives an indecent proposal from a member of the audience.<ref name="Private"/> Bonner said that he and Wilson had dance lessons at the [[Ministry of Dance]] for the scenes.<ref name="Private"/>
Needing another job, Aaron decides to reinvent himself as a social media manager in mid-2016.<ref name="Client"/> He befriends his neighbour [[Xanthe Canning]] (Lilly Van der Meer) upon learning that she is being bullied online by [[internet troll|trolls]]. When Aaron realises that Xanthe is trying to lose weight and change her appearance, he becomes her mentor and tells her to ignore the trolls.<ref name="Crawford"/> Aaron then launches his own brand management company and Nate helps fund it.<ref name="Client">{{cite journal|date=16–30 May 2016|title=The client list|journal=TV Soap|page=41}}</ref> Just as Aaron starts to feel disheartened, Paul Robinson asks Aaron to help him clear his name after he is charged with causing the Lassiter's explosion. Paul explains that he just wants to change public opinion of him and Aaron agrees to help.<ref name="Client"/> He comes up with a strategy to use social media, as traditional media sources will not touch the story. Aaron convinces [[Piper Willis]] (Mavournee Hazel) to interview Paul for her [[vlog]].<ref name="Client"/>
In 2017, Aaron explores another new career when he teams up with [[Mishti Sharma]] (Scarlet Vas) to purchase and run a gym.<ref name="Gym">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a832220/neighbours-spoilers-aaron-mishti-huge-decision/|title=Neighbours' Aaron Brennan makes a huge decision and it's good news for Mishti Sharma|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=3 July 2017|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=31 August 2018}}</ref> Aaron and Mishti bond over their respective interests in fitness, and when they learn that a local gym, The Shed, is for sale, they decide to purchase it together.<ref name="Mishti">{{cite journal|date=8–14 July 2017|title=Mishti means business!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=27|page=34}}</ref> The pair are "left disappointed" when the gym is sold to someone else, however, when that sale falls through, Mishti puts in an offer, which is accepted.<ref name="Gym"/> When Mishti goes to tell Aaron what she has done, she learns that he does not want to buy the business anymore. But Aaron changes his mind when Sonya gives him a "confidence boost" by pointing out how his friendly persona and love of fitness would make him a great gym owner.<ref name="Gym"/> Of Mishti's bond with Aaron, Vas commented, "I think her friendship with Aaron is really cute. They're different, but fitness brings them together. Plus it's so much fun working with Matt Wilson [Aaron]. He's the kindest person."<ref name="Mishti"/>
==Reception== {{Quote box|width=20%|align=right|bgcolor=#FDF5E6|quote="I have been waiting for people to be mean but they just haven't. It could be something to do with the character. Aaron is not a bad guy at all, he is very generous and considerate of others. I have hit the jackpot with this guy."<ref name="Bradley"/>|source=—Wilson's on how well Aaron has been received by viewers. (2016)}} For his portrayal of Aaron, Wilson received a nomination for Best Daytime Star at the 2018 [[Inside Soap Awards|''Inside Soap'' Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/coronation-street/news/a862268/inside-soap-awards-2018-full-longlist-coronation-street-eastenders-emmerdale-hollyoaks/|title=Inside Soap Awards 2018 full longlist revealed: Which Corrie, EastEnders, Emmerdale and Hollyoaks stars are up?|last=Davies|first=Megan|date=24 July 2018|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=24 July 2018}}</ref> Aaron and David's partnership was nominated for Best Soap Couple at the 2018 ''[[Digital Spy]]'' Reader Awards.<ref name="DS 2018">{{cite news |last1=Robinson |first1=Abby |title=The Digital Spy Reader Awards 2018: Vote now for your Soap favourites of the year! |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/feature/a871228/best-soap-2018/ |accessdate=1 December 2018 |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]] |date=29 November 2018}}</ref>
Shannon Molloy of [[news.com.au]] observed that Aaron made a "colourful and abrupt entrance".<ref name="Molloy"/> While an ''Inside Soap'' writer stated "Let's just say that the hunky new Brennan brother, Aaron, makes quite an entrance…"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.insidesoap.co.uk/5-top-treats-from-tuesday-nights-soaps/|title=Five top treats from Tuesday night’s soaps!|date=30 June 2015|work=[[Inside Soap]]|accessdate=21 June 2016}}</ref> Another contributor to the publication wrote that the character "made quite the impression".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.insidesoap.co.uk/phwoarsday-its-a-neighbours-brennan-brother-bonanza/|title=Phwoarsday: It's a Neighbours Brennan brother bonanza!|date=2 July 2015|work=[[Inside Soap]]|accessdate=21 June 2016}}</ref> Anthony D. Langford from [[TheBacklot.com]] admitted to being surprised that the producers had made one of the Brennan brothers gay.<ref name="NewGay">{{cite web|url=http://www.thebacklot.com/langford-on-soaps-neighbours-gets-a-sexy-new-gay/06/2015/|title=Langford On Soaps: "Neighbours" Gets A Sexy New Gay|last=Langford|first=Anthony D.|date=3 June 2015|publisher=[[TheBacklot.com]]|accessdate=18 April 2016}}</ref> He also questioned whether Aaron's love life would be "as messy and complicated as his brothers' tend to be" and hoped Wilson had been cast for more than his body and appearance.<ref name="NewGay"/>
Claire Crick from ''All About Soap'' was pleased to meet the latest Brennan brother, commenting "We've been waiting for weeks in the ''All About Soap'' office, and as of today Aaron Brennan is finally on our screens. Hurrah! And he certainly arrived with a bang, didn't he?"<ref name="Crick">{{cite web|url=http://www.allaboutsoap.co.uk/neighbours-new-brennan-brother/|title=We're all talking about...Neighbours' new Brennan brother!|last=Crick|first=Claire|date=1 July 2015|work=[[All About Soap]]|accessdate=18 April 2016}}</ref> Crick went on to say that Aaron was a mix of his two brothers' personalities and a good dancer. She also branded him "lovely Aaron".<ref name="Crick"/> Digital Spy's Daniel Kilkelly dubbed the character "Erinsborough's nice guy".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a786348/neighbours-star-matt-wilson-promises-a-darker-storyline-for-aaron-its-really-challenging/|title=Neighbours star Matt Wilson promises a darker storyline for Aaron: 'It's really challenging'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=10 March 2016|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref> While Will Stroude of ''[[Attitude (magazine)|Attitude]]'' labelled him "Ramsay Street's ravishing new resident" and "Mark and Tyler's mischievous middle brother".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://attitude.co.uk/meet-neighbours-new-gay-male-stripper-star-matt-wilson/|title=Meet 'Neighbours' new gay male stripper star, Matt Wilson|last=Stroude|first=Will|date=6 August 2015|work=[[Attitude (magazine)|Attitude]]|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Aaron's arrival was named one of "the best bits of July" by a writer for the ''Inside Soap Yearbook 2016''.<ref>{{cite journal|date=November 2015|title=The best bits of July – Hot stuff!|journal=[[Inside Soap|Inside Soap Yearbook 2016]]|issue=1|pages=54}}</ref>
Langford, now writing for ''[[TVSource Magazine]]'', said that he was not a fan of Aaron's relationship with Nate. He found the pairing to be lacking in chemistry and "terribly boring". He added "I just don't believe a guy like Aaron would date a total downer like Nate."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tvsourcemagazine.com/2016/03/gays-lives-getting-busy-neighbours/2/|title=Gays of Our Lives: Getting Busy With 'The Neighbours'|last=D. Langford|first=Anthony|date=14 March 2016|work=[[TVSource Magazine]]|accessdate=21 June 2016}}</ref> A ''Soap World'' columnist named Aaron the Best New Male Character during their feature on the highs and lows of soap operas in 2015.<ref name="HL">{{cite journal|date=January 2016|title=2015 highs & lows|journal=Soap World|issue=277|page=16}}</ref> The columnist wrote, "As we got to know Aaron, there was even more to like as he made his mark with his cheeky and playful personality. In a refreshing change, the very masculine looking Aaron turned out to be gay, proving that you can't always judge a book by its cover."<ref name="HL"/>

{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2012}} {{Use British English|date=December 2012}} {{Infobox UK legislation |short_title =Academies Act 2010 |parliament =Parliament of the United Kingdom |long_title =An Act to make provision about Academies. |statute_book_chapter =2010 c. 32 |introduced_by =[[Lord Wallace of Saltaire]] |territorial_extent =England and Wales |royal_assent =27 July 2010 |commencement =29 July 2010, 1 September 2010, 1 January 2011<ref>[http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2010/1937/pdfs/uksi_20101937_en.pdf The Academies Act 2010 (Commencement and Transitional Provisions) Order 2010 SI 2010/1937]</ref> |repeal_date = |amendments = |related_legislation =Education Act 1996, [[School Standards and Framework Act 1998]], [[Education Act 2002]], [[Education Act 2005]], [[Education and Inspections Act 2006]], Apprenticeships, Skills, Children and Learning Act 2009, Children, Schools and Families Act 2010 |repealing_legislation= |status =Current |original_text =http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2010/32/enacted |use_new_UK-LEG = yes |legislation_history =http://services.parliament.uk/bills/2010-11/academieshl.html }} The '''Academies Act 2010''' is an [[Act of Parliament|Act]] of the [[Parliament of the United Kingdom]]. It aims to make it possible for all publicly funded schools in England to become [[Academy (English school)|academies]], still publicly funded but with a vastly increased degree of autonomy in issues such as setting teachers' wages and diverging from the [[National Curriculum (England, Wales and Northern Ireland)|National Curriculum]].<ref name="BBCQ&A">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/10161371.stm |title=Q&A: Academies and free schools |date=26 May 2010 |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref> The Act is inspired by the [[Education in Sweden|Swedish free school system]].<ref name="BBCQ&A"/> Journalist [[Mike Baker (journalist)|Mike Baker]] described it as a "recreation of [[grant-maintained school]]s".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-10824069 |title=Gove's academies: 1980s idea rebranded? |first=Mike |last=Baker |date=31 July 2010 |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref>
It was among the first government bills introduced in the 55th United Kingdom Parliament by the [[Cameron–Clegg coalition|Conservative – Liberal Democrat coalition government]]. The bill was presented by [[Jonathan Hill, Baron Hill of Oareford]] in the [[House of Lords]], where it had its [[third reading]] on 13 July. It was read a third time in the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]] on 26 July. The Act received [[Royal Assent]] on the following day and was brought into force in the most part on 29 July.
Angela Harrison, education correspondent for the [[BBC]], has said that the Act "could be the most radical overhaul of schools in England for a generation".<ref name="BBC revolution">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/10159448.stm |title=Schools are promised an academies 'revolution' |date=26 May 2010 |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref>
==Provisions== An Academy may be set up under section 1 of the Act by virtue of an agreement between the [[Secretary of State for Education]] and any other person. Alternatively, maintained schools may be converted into academies by an Academy Order made under section 4 of the Act, provided that the governing body of the school has applied under section 3 or the school is eligible for intervention under sections 60-62 of the [[Education and Inspections Act 2006]]. Academies established under section 1 will be [[charitable organization|charities]] in addition to receiving funding from the central government.<ref name="BBCQ&A"/> Academies will also be free to set their own curriculum, as long as it is "broad and balanced"<ref name="BBCQ&A"/> meeting the standards set in section 78 of the [[Education Act 2002]]. The Act will only affect schools in England.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.education.gov.uk/academies/bill |title=Academies Bill |publisher=[[Department for Education]] |accessdate=17 July 2010 |quote=The Bill extends to England and Wales but only has application to England. While sections of the Bill do technically extend to Wales, the effect of the provisions will only permit an Academy to be established in England, so it will have no practical impact on, or application to, the organisation of schools in Wales.| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100710154828/http://www.education.gov.uk/academies/bill| archivedate= 10 July 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref>
==Initial schools== Prior to the [[United Kingdom general election, 2010|2010 General Election]] there were 203 academies in England.<ref name="BBCQ&A"/> After the election the new [[Secretary of State for Education|Education Secretary]] [[Michael Gove]] sent a letter to all publicly funded schools inviting them to become academies. Within three weeks, 70% of all outstanding [[secondary school]]s expressed interest.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/education/10338892.stm |title=Academy bids from 70% of top secondary schools - Gove |date=17 June 2010 |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref> Of the 1,567 schools initially expressing interest, 828 were rated "outstanding" and could be fast-tracked into academies by September 2010.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/education/10413492.stm |title=Would-be academy list published |date=25 June 2010 |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref> An analysis of the list applicants for academy status by the ''[[Times Educational Supplement]]'' reported that the list was "dominated" by schools from [[middle class]] areas, particularly the [[Home Counties]]. For example, 12% of schools in [[Kent]] applied compared to less than 2% in [[Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{Cite web | last = Vaughan | first = Richard | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Wealthy to dominate academies | work = | publisher = The Times Educational Supplement | date = 2 July 2010 | url = http://www.tes.co.uk/article.aspx?storycode=6049283 | format = | doi = | accessdate = 4 July 2010 }}</ref> A later list published by the Department for Education said a total of 1,907 schools had expressed an interest.
By 23 July 2010, 153 schools in England had applied for academy status.<ref>{{Cite web | last = Shepherd | first = Jessica | last2 = Wintour | first2 = Patrick | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Michael Gove's academy plan under fire as scale of demand emerges | work = | publisher = The Guardian | date = 29 July 2010 | url = https://www.theguardian.com/education/2010/jul/29/michael-gove-academies-schools-claims | format = | doi = | accessdate = 31 July 2010 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100801033245/http://www.guardian.co.uk/education/2010/jul/29/michael-gove-academies-schools-claims| archivedate= 1 August 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> The list included 12 [[faith schools]] and more than 20 [[grammar schools]]. Ultimately, 32 new academies (including seven primary schools) opened under the provisions of the Act in the autumn term of 2010. A further 110 schools (including 40 primaries) are planned to convert at a later date.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-11151559 |title=First wave of 32 new-style academies open this week |first=Sean |last=Coughlan |date=1 September 2010 |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref> By January 2011 a total of 407 primary and secondary schools with academy status existed (twice as many as before the 2010 election), with the 371 secondary academies representing 11% of the total number of secondary schools.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-12121889 |date=6 January 2011 |title=Academy school numbers 'double' |first=Sean |last=Coughlan |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref>
==Reaction and analysis== [[Official Opposition (United Kingdom)|Opposition]] MPs and the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] chair of the [[Education Select Committee]] [[Graham Stuart (UK politician)|Graham Stuart]] accused the government of "rushing" the bill through Parliament,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-10664722 |title=Academies Bill 'rushed through' claim |date=17 July 2010 |first=Angela |last=Harrison |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref> to which the government replied that there was "ample time" to debate the bill.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-10681793 |title='Ample time' for Academies Bill, says Michael Gove |date=19 July 2010 |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref> [[Julian Glover (journalist)|Julian Glover]] said the "rush hides not the enormity but the thinness of the measure; opposition outrage enhancing the impression that something big must be under way" and the Act "concedes no new powers of any importance".<ref>{{Citation | last = Glover | first = Julian | author-link = | last2 = | first2 = | author2-link = | title =Labour reacts to Michael Gove's academies bill like a childhood nightmare | newspaper = The Guardian | pages = | date = 26 Jul 2010 | url =https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2010/jul/26/labour-michael-gove-academies-bill-nightmare| accessdate = 5 August 2010 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100729132039/http://www.guardian.co.uk/commentisfree/2010/jul/26/labour-michael-gove-academies-bill-nightmare| archivedate= 29 July 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>
The Act aims to enshrine greater freedoms for schools given academy status.<ref>http://www.tes.co.uk/article.aspx?storycode=6045171</ref> Janet Daley says this will liberate schools from "monolithic local authority control"<ref>{{Citation | last = Daley | first = Janet | author-link = | last2 = | first2 = | author2-link = | title = Michael Gove can earn the gratitude of a generation | newspaper = Daily Telegraph | pages = | date = 24 Jul 2010 | url =https://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/columnists/janetdaley/7908439/Michael-Gove-can-earn-the-gratitude-of-a-generation.html | accessdate = 5 August 2010 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100812105747/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/columnists/janetdaley/7908439/Michael-Gove-can-earn-the-gratitude-of-a-generation.html| archivedate= 12 August 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> while journalist [[Toby Young]] said the Act will revitalise the goal of the existing academies system to provide an increased level of choice for parents.<ref>{{Citation | last = Riddell | first = Mary | author-link = | last2 = Young | first2 = Toby | author2-link = Toby Young | title = Mary Riddell v Toby Young: Education debate | newspaper = publisher = National Governors Association | date = 28 May 2010 | url = http://www.nga.org.uk/news.aspx | format = | doi = | accessdate = 29 June 2010 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100717063057/http://www.nga.org.uk/news.aspx| archivedate= 17 July 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> The [[National Grammar Schools Association]] warned [[grammar school]]s against becoming academies, saying that "there are fears that academies may not be legally defined as 'maintained' schools, in which case they may lose the statutory protection of requiring a parental ballot before they are turned into [[comprehensive school]]s."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/education/10394055.stm |title=Grammars are advised against becoming academies |date=23 June 2010 |newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]}}</ref>

{{Use mdy dates|date=February 2013}} {{Infobox organization | name = American Student Government Association | image = ASGA logo.gif | formation = 2001 | status = Active | headquarters = Gainesville, Florida | region_served = United States | leader_title = Leadership | leader_name = W.H. "Butch" Oxendine, Jr. | budget = | website = http://www.asgahome.com | remarks = }}The '''American Student Government Association''' ('''ASGA''') was founded in 2001 as a professional association for collegiate [[Student Governments]] and [[Student Government Associations]] across the United States.
== History == ASGA was founded by [[Oxendine Publishing, Inc.]], which published ''[[Student Leader (magazine)|Student Leader]]'' magazine,<ref>http://www.studentleader.com</ref> books,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/s/ref=ntt_athr_dp_sr_1?_encoding=UTF8&sort=relevancerank&search-alias=books&field-author=Butch%20Oxendine |title=Butch Oxendine: Books |publisher=Amazon.com |date=February 25, 2002 |accessdate=February 5, 2013}}</ref> and web sites<ref>http://www.sgconsultant.com</ref> on student leadership.
ASGA's research and experts <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.muhlenbergweekly.com/student-government-pairs-up-with-the-asga-1.2498024#.UQbLUfLwmSo |title=Student Government pairs up with the ASGA |publisher=Muhlenberg Weekly |date= |accessdate=February 5, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=raquel sghiatti · Daily Trojan |url=http://dailytrojan.com/2011/04/03/despite-national-trend-women-well-represented-in-usc-student-government/ |title=Despite national trend, women well represented in USC student government |publisher=Dailytrojan.com |date=April 3, 2011 |accessdate=February 5, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usishield.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=921:greeks-and-stuff-&catid=40:campus-news&Itemid=116 |title=Are you represented? |publisher=Usishield.com |date=February 9, 2012 |accessdate=February 5, 2013}}</ref> have been referenced in hundreds of newspapers nationwide.<ref>"contact us" at www.asgaonline.com under press clippings and also from Google search of ASGA and American Student Government Association</ref> " ASGA's "SG Database" gathers information on trends in higher education, including the number of women and ethnic minorities,<ref>[http://www.sptimes.com/2004/09/09/news_pf/State/The_minority_presiden.shtml]</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Jenna Johnson |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/education/on-college-campuses-a-gender-gap-in-student-government/2011/03/10/ABim1Bf_story.html |title=On college campuses, a gender gap in student government |publisher=The Washington Post |date=March 16, 2011 |accessdate=February 5, 2013}}</ref> as well as trends in election turnout, and compensation paid to elected student government officers and members <ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/02/03/education/edlife/big-names-on-campus.html?smid=fb-share | work=The New York Times | first=Laura | last=Pappano | title=Big Names on Campus | date=February 1, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://badgerherald.com/news/2002/05/09/student_government_s.php |title=Student Government salaries vary among universities |publisher=The Badger Herald |date= |accessdate=February 5, 2013}}</ref>
== ASGA Membership == ASGA has over 1,400 member student governments at the nearly 5,000 institutions across the United States.
== ASGA Events == Since 2005, ASGA has produced 130 conferences for student government leaders and advisors. 3,000 students and administrators attend 10 ASGA conferences each year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asgaonline.com/conferences |title=Conferences | American Student Government Association (ASGA) |publisher=Asgaonline.com |date= |accessdate=February 5, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081007221044/http://www.asgaonline.com/conferences |archivedate=October 7, 2008 |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author='+relativeTimebox3(this.created_at)+' |url=http://www.marygrove.edu/home/news/faculty-students/1062-marygrove-elects-student-government-on-the-road-to-change.html |title=Marygrove Elects Student Government. On the Road to Change. - Marygrove College |publisher=Marygrove.edu |date= |accessdate=February 5, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120123040922/http://www.marygrove.edu/home/news/faculty-students/1062-marygrove-elects-student-government-on-the-road-to-change.html |archivedate=January 23, 2012 |df=mdy }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.minotstateu.edu/redgreen/2010_2011/10-21-2010_RG_hires.pdf |title=Archived copy |access-date=January 28, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120319163514/http://www.minotstateu.edu/redgreen/2010_2011/10-21-2010_RG_hires.pdf |archive-date=March 19, 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.adams.edu/asf-voices/2011/asga-washington-d-c-conference-recap/ |title=ASGA Washington D.C. Conference Recap |publisher=adams.edu |date=October 14, 2011 |accessdate=February 5, 2013}}</ref> 700 student leaders attend the National Student Government Summit annually.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asgaonline.com/conferences/national |title=Conference Home | ASGA's National Student Government Summit |publisher=Asgaonline.com |date= |accessdate=February 5, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081119154206/http://www.asgaonline.com/conferences/national |archivedate=November 19, 2008 |df=mdy }}</ref>
== ASGA Mission == The American Student Government Association will provide all Student Government leaders and advisors nationwide with networking, research, and information resources and will teach them how to become more effective, ethical, and influential leaders on their campuses. ASGA also will promote the advancement of SGs, conduct research as the nation’s only “SG Think Tank,” and advocate the importance of having a vibrant, autonomous Student Government organization at every institution in America.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asgaonline.com/ME2/Default.asp |title=American Student Government Association (ASGA) |publisher=Asgaonline.com |date= |accessdate=February 5, 2013}}</ref>
== External links == *[http://www.asgaonline.com American Student Government Association]. ASGA is the professional association for collegiate Student Government across the United States. *[http://www.studentleader.com Student Leader magazine]. Founded in 1992, ''Student Leader'' was ASGA's official member magazine, but also had subscribers at more than 1,000 colleges and universities nationwide.
==References== <references />

{{Orphan|date=September 2014}}
'''Amy Catanzano''' (born 1974) is an American poet from [[Boulder, CO]]. She is the author of ''Multiversal'', which won the PEN USA Literary Award in Poetry. [[Michael Palmer (poet)|Michael Palmer]] describes her work as "a poetic vision of multiple orders and multiple forms, of a fluid time set loose from linearity, and an open space that is motile and multidimensional."<ref>{{cite web|title=Fordham University Press|url=http://fordhampress.com/index.php/mutiversa-paperback.html}}</ref> Since 2009 she has published writing on a theory and practice called "quantum poetics," which explores the intersections of poetry and science, particularly physics.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jerome Rothenberg: Poems and Poetics|url=http://poemsandpoetics.blogspot.com/2012/09/amy-catanzano-imaginary-present-poem.html}}</ref> Her other interests include cross-genre texts and the literary avant-garde.<ref>{{cite web|title=Wake Forest University Department of English Faculty website|url=http://college.wfu.edu/english/about-us/faculty/amy-catanzano/}}</ref>
==Life and work==
Her first book of poetry, [http://www.spdbooks.org/Producte/9780981612997/iepiphany.aspx Epiphany], was published by [[Anne Waldman]].
In 2009, Catanzano's [http://fordhampress.com/index.php/mutiversa-paperback.html Multiversal] was published as the recipient of the Poets Out Loud Prize from [[Fordham University Press]]. ''Multiversal'' went on to receive the PEN USA Literary Award in Poetry.<ref>{{cite web|title=PEN Center USA Press Release|url=https://penusa.org/files/2010PENUSALitAwardsPressRelease.pdf}}</ref> Previous winners of the PEN USA Literary Award in Poetry include [[Claudia Rankine]], [[Anne Waldman]], Craig Santos Perez, Seido Ray Ronci, [[Juan Felipe Herrera]], [[Brian Turner (American poet)|Brian Turner]], [[Martha Ronk]], [[Donald Revell]], [[Norman Dubie]], [[Bob Kaufman]], [[Carl Rakosi]], [[Thom Gunn]], [[Czeslaw Milosz]], [[Mei-mei Berssenbrugge]], [[Michael Palmer (poet)|Michael Palmer]], and [[David Antin]].<ref>{{cite web|title=PEN USA Literary Award in Poetry Winners|url=https://penusa.org/awards/winners|access-date=2016-01-23|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161013053644/https://penusa.org/awards/winners|archive-date=2016-10-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
Catanzano's third full-length collection, [https://web.archive.org/web/20170506125439/http://www.noemipress.org/catalog/fiction/catanzano/ Starlight in Two Million: A Neo-Scientific Novella], combines poetry with fiction. It was published by Noemi Press in 2014 and won the Noemi Book Award.<ref>{{cite web|title=Wake Forest University Department of English Faculty website|url=http://college.wfu.edu/english/about-us/faculty/amy-catanzano/}}</ref> Cindra Halm in ''Rain Taxi'' writes that it "is a mind-full, mine-filled, field of literary, aesthetic, scientific, and imaginative constructs that take forms as collage, cultural allegory, anti-war expression, epistolary conversation, and song-of-joy-in-risk-taking, to list merely a few." <ref>{{cite web|title=Rain Taxi Review of Books|url=http://www.raintaxi.com/starlight-in-two-million-a-neo-scientific-novella/}}</ref>
Catanzano is an associate professor in creative writing and the poet-in-residence at [http://www.wfu.edu/ Wake Forest University]. She earned her MFA from the [[Iowa Writers' Workshop]] and taught at [[Naropa University]] until 2011, serving as the administrative director of the Department of Writing and Poetics in the [http://www.naropa.edu/academics/jks/ Jack Kerouac School of Disembodied Poetics]. She was also the managing editor for the literary magazine [http://www.naropa.edu/academics/jks/bombay-gin/index.php Bombay Gin].<ref>{{cite web|title=Wake Forest University Department of English Faculty website|url=http://college.wfu.edu/english/about-us/faculty/}}</ref>
==Awards and honors==
Arts and Humanities Award from Wake Forest University to conduct research on the [https://www.darkenergysurvey.org Dark Energy Survey] at the Cerro Tololo Inter-American Observatory in Chile.
[http://scgp.stonybrook.edu/archives/25297 2018 Poet in Residence, Simons Center for Geometry and Physics,] Stony Brook University.
Arts and Humanities Award from Wake Forest University to conduct research at the [https://home.cern Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN)] in Switzerland.
The [https://web.archive.org/web/20121022015026/http://noemipress.org/contest.html Noemi Press Book Award] for [https://web.archive.org/web/20140222203337/http://www.noemipress.org/catanzano.html Starlight in Two Million: A Neo-Scientific Novella], published in 2014.
''Starlight in Two Million: A Neo-Scientific Novella'' is part of the permanent collection of the 'Pataphysical Museum at The London Institute of 'Pataphysics.<ref>{{cite web|title=Wake Forest University Department of English Faculty website|url=http://college.wfu.edu/english/about-us/faculty/amy-catanzano/}}</ref>
The [http://www.penusa.org/awards PEN USA Literary Award in Poetry] for [http://fordhampress.com/index.php/mutiversa-paperback.html Multiversal].<ref>{{cite web|title=2010 PEN USA Literary Awards Press Release|url=http://www.penusa.org/files/2010PENUSALitAwardsPressRelease.pdf}}</ref>
Fordham University's [http://www.fordham.edu/academics/programs_at_fordham_/english/creative_writing/poets_out_loud/ Poets Out Loud Prize] for [https://www.amazon.com/Multiversal-Poets-Out-Loud-Catanzano/dp/0823230074/ref=sr_1_3?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1349995431&sr=1-3&keywords=amy+catanzano Multiversal], published in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|title=Fordham University Poets Out Loud|url=http://www.fordham.edu/academics/programs_at_fordham_/english/creative_writing/poets_out_loud/pol_books_22600.asp}}</ref>
==Quantum poetics==
Projects in quantum poetics from 2015-2018 include [http://scgp.stonybrook.edu/archives/25297 World Lines] (Simons Center for Geometry and Physics, 2018), [http://www.3dpoetryeditor.art Wavicles] (3D Poetry Editor, 2017), and [http://www.nextdoorpublishers.com/libros/nodos/ #NODOS] (Next Door Publishers, 2018).
In 2015, Catanzano wrote a series of essays about the intersections of poetry and science in a [http://jacket2.org/commentary/symbolic-multiplication Commentary Series on Quantum Poetics] at [[Jacket2]].
In 2012, Gilbert Adair curated a feature in Jacket2, [http://jacket2.org/feature/metaphor Like A Metaphor], that collects dialogues between contemporary poets who share an interest in science. These poets were [[Rae Armantrout]], Amy Catanzano, John Cayley, [[Tina Darragh]], Marcella Durand, [[Allen Fisher]], James Harvey, Peter Middleton, Evelyn Reilly, and [[Joan Retallack]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://college.wfu.edu/english/about-us/faculty/amy-catanzano/|title=Wake Forest University Department of English Faculty website}}</ref>
An essay in four sections, [http://poemsandpoetics.blogspot.com/2009/07/amy-catanzano-excerpt-from-quantum.html "Quantum Poetics: Writing the Speed of Light,"] by Catanzano appeared from 2009 to 2011 in [[Jerome Rothenberg]]'s [http://jacket2.org/commentary/jerome-rothenberg Poems and Poetics].<ref>{{cite web|title=Jerome Rothenberg: Poems and Poetics|url=http://poemsandpoetics.blogspot.com/2012/09/amy-catanzano-imaginary-present-poem.html}}</ref> In it she says of quantum poetics: "By applying principles in theoretical physics to poetry, quantum poetics investigates how physical reality is assumed, imagined, and tested through language at discernible and indiscernible scales of spacetime."<ref>{{cite web|title=Quantum poetics: Writing the Speed of Light |url=http://poemsandpoetics.blogspot.com/2009/07/amy-catanzano-excerpt-from-quantum.html/ |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160220114713/http://poemsandpoetics.blogspot.com/2009/07/amy-catanzano-excerpt-from-quantum.html |archivedate=2016-02-20 }}</ref>
==Bibliography==
[http://scgp.stonybrook.edu/archives/25297 World Lines: A Quantum Supercomputer Poem] (Simons Center for Geometry and Physics, 2018). Limited-edition chapbook.
[http://www.3dpoetryeditor.art Wavicles] (3D Poetry Editor, 2017). Digital poem on wave-particle duality created with 3D Editor software. Exhibited at the Rotterdam International Poetry Festival.
[https://www.perfectwave.org/vol-4/ from Borealis Tesseract in the Fourth Dimension] (Perfect Wave, 2017).
[https://spacecraftpress.wordpress.com/2015/06/11/spacecraft-023-let-there-be-love-by-amy-catanzano/ Let There Be Love] (Spacecraft Press, 2015). Limited-edition pamphlet, reprinted from ''Starlight in Two Million: A Neo-Scientific Novella''.
[https://web.archive.org/web/20170506125439/http://www.noemipress.org/catalog/fiction/catanzano/ Starlight in Two Million: A Neo-Scientific Novella] (Noemi Press, 2014). Recipient of the Noemi Press Book Award for Fiction. {{ISBN|978-1934819395}}
[http://fordhampress.com/index.php/mutiversa-paperback.html Multiversal] (Fordham University Press, 2009). Recipient of the Poets Out Loud Prize and the PEN USA Literary Award in Poetry. {{ISBN|978-0823230075}}
''the heartbeat is a fractal'', e-chapbook ([[Ahadada Books]], 2009).
[http://www.spdbooks.org/Producte/9780981612997/iepiphany.aspx iEpiphany] (Erudite Fangs Editions, 2008). {{ISBN|978-0981612997}}
Her poetry has been published in [[Colorado Review]], [[Conjunctions]], [[Denver Quarterly]], [[Fence (magazine)]], [[New American Writing]], [[Tarpaulin Sky Press]], [[Washington Square Review]], and elsewhere.
==References==
{{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.raintaxi.com/starlight-in-two-million-a-neo-scientific-novella/ Review of Amy Catanzano's Starlight in Two Million at Rain Taxi] * [https://jacket2.org/interviews/impossible-poems-invisible-scales Interview with Amy Catanzano at Jacket2 on Starlight in Two Million] * [http://queenmobs.com/2015/05/a-collaborative-review-of-amy-catanzanos-starlight-in-two-million/ Review of Amy Catanzano's Starlight in Two Million at Queen Mob's Teahouse] * [http://entropymag.org/what-how-with-whom-two-questions-for-amy-catanzano/ Interview with Amy Catanzano at ''Entropy'' magazine on Starlight in Two Million] * [http://jacket2.org/commentary/what-stake-inwhen-defining-poetry Amy Catanzano at Jacket2 on defining poetry] * [http://io9.com/5885724/the-perfect-poetry-for-every-type-of-science-fiction-fan io9.com: The Best Books of Poetry for Every Kind of Science Fiction Fan, By Rebecca Porte] * [https://jacket2.org/commentary/amy-catanzano-%E2%80%9C-imaginary-present%E2%80%9D-poem-commentary-quantum-poetics Poems and Poetics: The Imaginary Present by Amy Catanzano] * [https://soundcloud.com/naropa-jack-kerouac-school/klimator-amy-catanzano-and Audio collaboration between Amy Catanzano and Kyle Pivarnik for Naropa University's JKS 30/30 Poetic Vision] * [http://www.du.edu/denverquarterly/media/documents/44_3Celona.pdf Tina Brown Celona's review of Amy Catanzano's ''Multiversal'' and ''iEpiphany'' in ''Denver Quarterly'']
{{authority control}}
